intro: Packera scalaris, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually grayish-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Packera scalaris produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
